ResponsesInList.Title: Unable to pull written response (comments) from feedback using SQL
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, We currently have 10 questions in our feedback activity over 50 courses. The last question is a text box where students are asked any other aspects of the course you would like to comment on. I would like to bulk download I am an SQL beginner at best and have managed to get the following working... except for the last question of written comments. I thought the prefix_feedback_value was the prefix that managed this.. but im wrong? Can anyone help to edit this SQL so I can also download the comments and responses from all feedback activities please? SELECT c.fullname as "Course", f.name AS "Feedback", DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fc.timemodified), '%Y-%m-%d %H:%i') AS "When", IF(i.typ = 'label', i.presentation, i.name) AS "Question", CASE WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN SUBSTRING(i.presentation,7) END AS "Possible Answers", CASE i.typ WHEN 'multichoice' THEN v.value ELSE '-' END AS "Chosen Answer Num", CASE v.value WHEN 1 THEN SUBSTRING(i.presentation, 7, POSITION('|' IN i.presentation) - 7) ELSE CONCAT("More:", v.value) END AS "Chosen Answer Text" FROM prefix_feedback AS f JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id=f.course JOIN prefix_feedback_item AS i ON f.id=i.feedback JOIN prefix_feedback_completed AS fc ON f.id=fc.feedback LEFT JOIN prefix_feedback_value AS v ON v.completed=fc.id AND v.item=i.id WHERE i.typ IN ('label', 'multichoice') Look I know its not that pretty - but I am trying! ahahahah Thanks Sammi

ResponsesInList.Title: Unable to pull written response (comments) from feedback using SQL
ResponsesInList.Text: Fixed SELECT c.fullname AS Course, f.name AS Feedback, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fc.timemodified), '%Y-%m-%d %H:%i') AS CompletedAt, u.firstname AS FirstName, u.lastname AS LastName, u.username AS Username, IF(i.typ = 'label', i.presentation, i.name) AS Question, CASE WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN i.presentation ELSE NULL END AS PossibleAnswers, CASE WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN v.value ELSE NULL END AS ChosenAnswerNum, CASE -- For multichoice, extract the Nth option from the presentation text (options separated by '|') WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' AND v.value REGEXP '^[0-9]+$' THEN TRIM( SUBSTRING_INDEX( SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation, '|', CAST(v.value AS UNSIGNED)), '|', -1) ) -- If MCQ but stored value isn‚Äôt numeric, just show it raw WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN CONCAT('Other: ', v.value) -- Free-text responses WHEN i.typ IN ('textarea','text') THEN v.value -- Numeric answers WHEN i.typ = 'numeric' THEN v.value ELSE NULL END AS ResponseText FROM prefix_feedback AS f JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = f.course JOIN prefix_feedback_item AS i ON f.id = i.feedback JOIN prefix_feedback_completed AS fc ON f.id = fc.feedback LEFT JOIN prefix_feedback_value AS v ON v.completed = fc.id AND v.item = i.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON fc.userid = u.id %%FILTER_CATEGORIES:c.category%% WHERE i.typ IN ('label','multichoice','textarea','text','numeric') ORDER BY c.fullname, fc.timemodified

ResponsesInList.Title: Unable to pull written response (comments) from feedback using SQL
ResponsesInList.Text: SELECT c.fullname AS Course, f.name AS Feedback, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fc.timemodified), '%Y-%m-%d %H:%i') AS CompletedAt, IF(i.typ = 'label', i.presentation, i.name) AS Question, CASE WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN i.presentation ELSE NULL END AS PossibleAnswers, CASE WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN v.value ELSE NULL END AS ChosenAnswerNum, CASE -- For multichoice, extract the Nth option from the presentation text (options separated by '|') WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' AND v.value REGEXP '^[0-9]+$' THEN TRIM( SUBSTRING_INDEX( SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation, '|', CAST(v.value AS UNSIGNED)), '|', -1) ) -- If MCQ but stored value isn‚Äôt numeric, just show it raw WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN CONCAT('Other: ', v.value) -- Free-text responses WHEN i.typ IN ('textarea','text') THEN v.value -- Numeric answers WHEN i.typ = 'numeric' THEN v.value ELSE NULL END AS ResponseText FROM prefix_feedback AS f JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = f.course JOIN prefix_feedback_item AS i ON f.id = i.feedback JOIN prefix_feedback_completed AS fc ON f.id = fc.feedback LEFT JOIN prefix_feedback_value AS v ON v.completed = fc.id AND v.item = i.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON fc.userid = u.id %%FILTER_CATEGORIES:c.category%% WHERE i.typ IN ('label','multichoice','textarea','text','numeric') ORDER BY c.fullname, fc.timemodified

ResponsesInList.Title: Allow non-logged in users to give feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: In the Feedback FAQ under How can I allow non-logged in users to give feedback? it says: As an administrator, go to Administration>Site Administration>Plugins>Activity Modules>Feedback . Change "Allow full anonymous" to "yes" Note that this only works for the front page , and NOT for courses with guest access. You will also need to check that Authenticated User and Guest role both have permission to Submit Feedback Activity. OK, so how do I check that Authenticated User and Guest role both have permission to Submit Feedback Activity.?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allow non-logged in users to give feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Dan, You need to Go to Site admin > Users > Define roles. Edit the Authenticated user role. Enter mod/feedback:complete in the Filter box. Make sure that the permission is set to allow.

ResponsesInList.Title: missing answers in feedback export
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, this occurs only with a subset of items in a feedback (feedback set as not anonymous, all items set as obligatory). I cannot see what is specific about these items, only that they are separated from the others by two page breaks. The graphic representation of each item results indicates that the data seems complete. N adds up to the number of participants. The csv export however contains empty answer cells. Some do contain answers, other cells are empty. What could be the reason? Is there any way to retrieve the missing data (i.e. all answers to each of these items), maybe directly from the database ? Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: missing answers in feedback export
ResponsesInList.Text: The issue of missing answers seem to indicate an error in the database, but it is very simple to explain and to repair: The items referred to here are Likert scaled single choice questions. Different to the other Likert items in this feedback, here only the highest and lowest level have text labels. The levels inbetween are not labelled. In Moodle, answers are the text labels, not the numbering of the levels. So when answers are exported to a table, cells must be empty unless a level with a text label had been chosen. To repair, add labels where there are none, then export again. Existing data does not get affected.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback - "Allow multiple submissions" selection tip is not understandable
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Our teacher questioned the tip's text (the question mark) on Feedback, Settings, below "Question and submission settings" on the line "Allow multiple submissions". Text is now (Moodle 4.1.x - our: 4.1.14): "If enabled for anonymous surveys, users can submit feedback an unlimited number of times". Same is translated from this correctly same to Finnish. The question is: Should this be automatically allowed to answer multiple times when it is "Anonymous" - selection above? The tip gives the idea to that way. Should the tip's text be: "If this is enabled, answering multiple (or unlimited) times¬†is allowed ". Simple as that. And also translations must be changed to similar. Reality in functionality is that this must be selected in any case to "Yes" when multiple answers is actually allowed when this is anonymous or not. If there is "No", all participants can answer only once (and quest access does not allow doing activities like write to this forum). Next point is the instructions to this: https://docs.moodle.org/405/en/Feedback_settings " Allow multiple submissions Choose here whether or not to allow users to complete the feeback more than once. This is important when using Feedback for anonymous surveys on the front page as it will allow non-logged in users to complete the feedback." Should this be even more clear and more understandable (and of course fix the writing error "feeback" to "feedback" on text)? This leads to think that Activity completion does not work if it is anonymous and allowed answering multiple times. Reality in our Moodle version is that is works in any case. Checked on the course with quest access allowed, feedback is not possible to use. No need to say "... non-logged ...". Maybe Google Translator translates this incorrect to mean "non logged people" like meaning "quest access" because guest cannot complete the feedback or start to answer it (at least what I know and have tested). Or does this mean that if the site front page (not course) is feedback as anonymous then ...¬† I don't quite understand. Teachers cannot set Feedback on site front page and I see this instructions page targeted more to teachers and less to site admins like me. And if I (or anyone our site admin team) cannot understand the tip or instructions page's message, how many teachers could understand it better (well, someone can but the point to most less technical people)? B.R. Petri H√∂rkk√∂

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback - "Allow multiple submissions" selection tip is not understandable
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. I corrected the typo for multiple submissions in the Feedback settings page, thanks. Regarding non-logged in users completing feedback on the front page, this is explained in the FAQ: How can I allow non-logged in users to give feedback? Also, note that anyone is free to suggest improvements to the English language wording¬† by submitting your suggestion to the Translation site and selecting¬† the English (fixes) (en_fix) language pack, as described in the documentation contributing a translation .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adhoc Task: assignfeedback_editpdf\task\convert_submission Failing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, just ran into a similar but quite other failure after updating to the newest version. 1st thing - you should try to find out if you even need the annotation plugin. It seems it got activated by itself, at least for me. Because I never ran into this issue before. In my case I didn't have Ghostscript configured, but this plugin needs it. So I simply resolved my problem by deactivating the plugin. You could do the same by going to "Website Administration" > Plugins > Look for PDF and simply deactivate it. 2nd thing - your error seems to be cause by the configuration of the mysql server . On the first look it seems that your connection settings are not optimized for moodle. Try to change settings like wait_timeout 60 (adjust higher if neccessary) max_allowed_packet 100m (adjust higher if neccessary) For me it seems, that the my sql server is disconnecting while moodle is trying to insert information. But that's just my first "wild" guess. aloha.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove preview questions button and link in Feedback Activity Moodle 4.0
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm finding that targeting the "Preview Questions" button with a CSS rule by using the ID doesn't work in Moodle 4.x because the ID changes every time the page is loaded or refreshed. I wrote and am using the following CSS on two self-hosted Moodle 4.1.1 sites and one Moodle 4.0.5 MoodleCloud site, all using the Boost Theme: /* hide Feedback activity Preview Questions button */ div.feedback_description div.navitem:first-of-type a.btn { display: none; } /* show Feedback activity Preview Questions button in Edit Mode */ body.editing div.feedback_description div.navitem:first-of-type a.btn { display: inline-block; } Both rules are needed. The first rule will hide the "Preview Questions" button for students, guests, facilitators, course creators, and parents. However, it also hides the "Edit Questions" button for managers and teachers (because the "Edit Questions" button is the first button in that div) making it impossible for them to edit the Feedback activity questions. The second rule displays the "Edit Questions" button when "Edit Mode" is turned on and hides it when "Edit Mode" is turned off. Although this means an extra step for managers and teachers, they can at least still edit the Feedback questions. A downside to this method is that it hides the "Preview Questions" button for facilitators so they can no longer see what questions are being asked in the Feedback activity. I haven't found a way around this. This method will only work as long as the "Preview Questions" button is in the first div with a class of "navitem" inside the div with a class of "feedback_description." If the HTML changes, the CSS will need to be updated. I'm using this as a workaround until https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-70586 is resolved. It would be much better to be able to handle the display of the "Preview Questions" button via role permissions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove preview questions button and link in Feedback Activity Moodle 4.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Minor correction/clarification to CSS comment for second rule: /* hide Feedback activity Preview Questions button */ div.feedback_description div.navitem:first-of-type a.btn { display: none; } /* show Feedback activity Edit Questions button in Edit Mode */ body.editing div.feedback_description div.navitem:first-of-type a.btn { display: inline-block; }

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove preview questions button and link in Feedback Activity Moodle 4.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Inspired by your solution, as well as by https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=356299#p1437215 , I have developed a variant for Moodle 3.11 whereby the Preview icon shows for the Teacher in the editing mode (while also those Teachers who "know" will find the invisible link in the usual place, as well). I described my CSS in this comment on the Tracker (the problem is solved now for Moodle 4 and up. but not for earlier versions): https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-70586?focusedCommentId=997750&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-997750 . Cheers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove preview questions button and link in Feedback Activity Moodle 4.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! In which file shall I paste this CSS code? I've tried in mod/feedback/styles.css but it doesn't work. I put it in the first line of the file. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove preview questions button and link in Feedback Activity Moodle 4.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Julien, On my sites, which all use the Boost theme, it goes in the "Raw SCSS" field for the theme. In Moodle, go to Site administration > Appearance. In the "Themes" section, click "Boost" (or your theme name). On the Boost (or your theme) page, click the tab for "Advanced settings." Paste the CSS in the "Raw SCSS" field. Scroll down and Save changes. Clear the theme caches: Appearance > Themes: Theme selector > Clear theme caches. Test to be sure you are getting the results you want for all roles. I hope this helps! Cam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making resources hidden/orphaned but still accessible?
ResponsesInList.Text: Orphaned activities went away a long time ago. Now, you just hide the activity and then go back to the drop down menu and select Make Accessible. This is the same as orphaning - you will see now on the course page - Available but not shown on course page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making resources hidden/orphaned but still accessible?

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback activity emailing ALL students and Teachers
ResponsesInList.Text: We are running Moodle 3.9 and when the enable notification of submissions is turned on, it emails -all- students in the course and all teachers each time a new submission is made. It would be really helpful if there was a field to add specific user email addresses, separated by comma.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback activity emailing ALL students and Teachers
ResponsesInList.Text: One thing to check is your course permissions -- in your course Admin block, click on Users - Permissions. See which roles are enabled for "mod/feedback:receivemail" -- it may need to be just the "Teacher" role and no other roles (if I am not mistaken, if a global role is enabled there too, such as 'Manager' role, it sends to anyone on the site with that role). Then, if the "Enable notification of submissions" setting is set to Yes, then when a submission is made, this should just email "all teachers" associated with that course.

ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Moodle users! The problem is that I have a lot of feedbacks to extract data from and prepare one overall report. Actually it is just one (the same) feedback activity copied to over a 350 courses, where students anonymously grade the teacher from that course. So far I have been doing all of this manually, entering each course separately, extracting the feedback results to Excel and copying them to a separate file with an overall summary. But that's extremely time-consuming. Is there any way to make it automated? Any help will be much appreciated! Can someone maybe point me to the direction on how I can build an SQL query to have a one set of data from a lot of different feedbacks? I have added "Configurable Reports" block to my dashboard and I am at the "Manage reports" page (moodle/blocks/configurable_reports/managereport.php?courseid=1), but without a clue what to do next. Thanks and best regards, Kajetan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL query to extract data from many different feedbacks
ResponsesInList.Text: To use configurable manager you need to have some working knowledge of sql. You then write a query that pulls from the feedback tables to give you the data that you need. A couple of thoughts though...1. If your students are having to enter the course to respond to the feedback then their answers really are not anonymous as it is easy to track which student gave which answer through the logs. 2. I tend to put a single feedback on the frontpage and make it accessible to users that are not logged in. Then I make the first question a drop down where they select the course they are giving feedback for. This has two advantages - it is truly anonymous. You can pull your data for all courses at one time through the feedback activity.

The problem is that the previous feedbacks have to be summarized and reported. I have some working knowledge of SQL, but I do not know what paths to start to look at in the Moodle database , to build a SQL query. Any help will be much appreciated. Thanks and best regards, Kajetan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: feedback (in a courseroom) for guests
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stephan I know your enquiry is quite old. Have you made any progress? I have come across similar requirements in many different cases. But there is a fundamental problem, how can Moodle differentiate two replies from two persons, if they both entered Moodle without a logging in? I know, it is thinkable that Moodle could differentiate their IP addresses, browser identification, etc. But there are no such implementations in Moodle to my knowledge. The only possibility is to allow multiple replies and _assume_ each reply is from a different person. Which is not accurate, perhaps somebody wants to correct his earlier reply and resubmit. Even if you exclude that, there is a big danger of a "script kiddie" ruining your survey. Really, it doesn't need much skill to make a script if no login is required.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using the Feedback for scoring scenarios
ResponsesInList.Text: Probably easiest would be to set up an assignment that doesn't require any type of submission, then under Grade > Grading method, select Rubric. Can also try the other options there. Then from the activity's Edit menu, select Advanced grading to setup your rubric. If you try the other options, set them up there also. Probably would need examples of what you are currently using to be of further help. Also would need to know how many individuals are being rated at one time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Suggest a "Grade" for the submission of feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: I am a big fan of the Moodle Feedback activity and have used it in a number of small research projects centred around my e-courses - see https://www.uib.no/en/radioweb/nuclear/specialist for references. I use Feedback in anonymous mode. One of the strengths of Feedback over competing modules is the template functionality. I currently run a big new e-course over 30 course weeks. The template functionality allows me to monitor each week with minimal labour for setting up the questions. Excellent! However, my course has a challenge. Each course week contains 3 - 4 quizes that need to be passed with at least 80 %. Then the week is passed in a binary fashion - either passed or not passed. Students have to pass all 30 days. I had trouble implementing this simple algorithm in standard Moodle and implemented a custom SQL query with the "Configurable Reports" plugin. However, there could be a much simpler way of settings things up if the "Feedback" activity had a grade. I would restrict access to the week's Feedback activity until all Query modules are passed with >= 80 %, then everyone who submitted feedback would get 100 % for the feedback activity. The course total would then be the sum of all feedback activities in the course. Kind regards Martin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suggest a "Grade" for the submission of feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: The requested functionality is probably not needed. I just discovered the settings under "Activity completion" in the settings of the feedback activity. This is all what is needed. Kind regards Martin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I uninstall all instances of the Feedback activity plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dominique, the Feedback block depends on the feedback activity. So in order to delete the activity you have to unistall the Feedback block first. After that you are able to uninstall the Feedback activity. Note: If you uninstall the block either your webserver has write permissions to the moodle directory or you have to delete the folder "blocks/feedback" manually. Otherwise the block starts to install itself again. Best regards Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I uninstall all instances of the Feedback activity plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: Many thanks Andreas. that's just what i needed to know. Best Dominique

ResponsesInList.Title: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am using the Feedback activity and need my Non-Editing Teachers to be able to see the responses (and the users who did them, so cannot be anonymous), but not see the "Show non-respondents" tab.¬† Reason being, I will have about 30 odd Feedback activities on the course, but users will only be able to see the one relevant to them (via using restricted access).¬† Currently the Non-respondents tab shows all users enrolled on the course and I do not want this to be available, as the non-editing teachers should only see the users relevant to their course. I have tried playing with the permissions, but if I hide reports to them, they cannot see the Responses either. Any help very much appreciated!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text:
If you have access to custom CSS in your theme, you can add 
```text
#page-mod-feedback-view a[title="Show non-respondents"] {display: none;}
```
 ...with the caveat that it will hide it for you too! If you don't have access to custom CSS, you can go to Site Administration > Appearance > Additional HTML and add the following in the box 'Within HEAD'... 
```text
<style>


#page-mod-feedback-view a[title="Show non-respondents"] {display: none;}


</style>
```
 üòÅ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jon Thank you so much!¬† Will try it now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jon It worked on the main page but as soon as I clicked on the 'Show responses' tab the 'Show non-respondents' tab appears again.¬† Do I need to put different html in the When BODY is opened box?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Take out the `#page-mod-feedback-view` bit. I was deliberately being very specific so that it didn‚Äôt have a unintentional impact elsewhere, but there won‚Äôt be many links with that title so it should only affect Feedback module.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: That worked.¬† Thank you so much for your help and quick responses!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text:
Great, pleased it worked üëç Can you humour me though (sorry!). There is a (very small) risk that now or in the future, there may be another link with that title in another part of Moodle. With this CSS, it will not display ANY link with that title, not just the ones in the Feedback activity... which is why I gave you the original code. Use this instead - it will only target the Feedback activity: 
```text
.path-mod-feedback a[title="Show non-respondents"] {display: none;}
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Yeah no problem! Swapped it over and it also works.¬† So, this code targets just the feedback activity?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hiding the "Show non-respondents" tab in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, that‚Äôs what the `.path-mod-feedback` bit does. Without that, any link that had the title of "Show non-respondents" in any activity would be hidden.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Tool for course evaluation surveys: questions
ResponsesInList.Text: Want to follow this. I would really like a single, global Feedback for a whole category of courses. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Tool for course evaluation surveys: questions
ResponsesInList.Text: We use the Feedback activity extensively for standardised evaluations amongst c 1500 courses per semester and we feed the data out to an analytics tool. I don't think this is really feasible through the web interface - we do it using the raw data. There's a complex set of relationships that are intended to obfuscate who the respondent actually is for anonymity, but you can indeed map each response back to the specific user if you need to through linking various tables (we have done this because one project wanted to compare evaluation feedback with course outcomes for each student - so we had to "unanonymise" them, combine them with completion and grade book statistics and then reanonymise the whole lot again. But to be honest, since Feedbacks can be used for lots of different things, it is tricky to be able to capture all the data without holding elsewhere a list of course module numbers that refer to the specific feedback activities we deploy centrally as evaluation forms. I was considering forking the feedback activity, to create something specifically called "evaluation feedback" so that for people like us who want to know the answers to the same set of questions to measure student experience across the whole institution, nobody else could tinker with them. But to answer some of the OP 's original questions: No, we could not find a way of "branching" questions. Yes, it can be locked at deployment time, but no, that means they can't edit it at all. We created a "course evaluation extra" feedback for if they wanted to ask additional questions on the basis that responses to these questions would not be extracted to the learning analytics system. But as I say, most of what we do is done a. by using data from the Moodle database rather than pre-built reports within the Feedback module itself, and b. the analysis is done by a back end stats package that we transfer data to. Jock

ResponsesInList.Title: Questionnaire  Feedback Missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm using Moodle 3.4.1 and am setting up a Personality Test Questionnaire but cannot find the feedback feature.¬† I've looked on various Moodle sites and see it in screen shots but we do not have it in our environment. I would appreciate any help or suggestions. Here is a picture of what I see: Thanks! Tonie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire  Feedback Missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Better late than never? Are you talking about questionnaire or feedback?¬† It looks like Questionnaire...which would mean this is in the wrong place.¬† They are different activities.¬† They do very similar things. Questionnaire is a third party plug in.¬† You'd need to download it and install it. Feedback is part of core. To create either, you have to go to the course you want it to appear and add an activity.¬† Then choose the one you're wanting and build the questions. That said...personality inventories usually have a result (You're a type A personality; you're a kinesthetic learner, etc).¬† Neither questionnaire or feedback can give students an analysis of their responses, it just gives you information.¬† If you want the learner to actually get feedback about the results, you might go for a quiz.¬† I ran a stress inventory for a long time--I turned off teachers' abilities to see the results and set up activity feedback based on score (99--Wow!¬† You're stressed!¬† You might talk to someone about working on de-stressing...0--Wow!¬† You're barely breathing!¬† That's a really low stress score, ect.).¬† If it looks at specifc domains, you could have each domain 's questions on a separate quiz and put in a bunch of labels with restrict access to specific number combinations.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire  Feedback Missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Melanie I found your response very useful here. I want to do something similar. What do you mean by: If it looks at specifc domains, you could have each domain 's questions on a separate quiz " and put in a bunch of labels with restrict access to specific number combinations." I want to give a students a quiz and based on their responses in each of 5 domain areas tell them what to go back and study in each domain (not just one domain) etc¬† similar to your approach - give them suggestions¬† (wow you scored 20% for knowledge in X, try the following...AA, BB, CC,, etc. I can see how i might be able to do this by having a seperate quiz for each domain - but can they be combined? thanks Karen

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire  Feedback Missing
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want more flexibility, like quizzes for topic 1A, 1B, 1C and if you don't get a super high score on A, B opens up, if you don't have a high score on B, C opens and then topic 2 opens when you get a good score on A or B or have done all three, etc, you wouldn't want to combine them. But you could add links in overall feedback at various levels that take them directly to the next piece or in Boost, I think the next activity links might work that way. But what I really meant was if you have five sections about personality (just for kicks, we'll go with helpfulness, agreeableness, openness, extroversion and conscientiousness) and we'll pretend that there are five questions on each topic and five on each means you're super friendly and 1 on each means you are super shy and not outgoing at all...you could set up labels (resource) with restrictions on when they display (only display if all 5 quiz results are 5 points [wow! you must be a really amazingly friendly and helpful person!]; only display if all 5 quizzes are 1 point [you're feeling some social anxiety, let's work on that!], only display if...), which would be really complicated to set up and see (for you) but would give very specific student feedback based on results...Maybe someone is super helpful--helpfulness of 5, but extremely shy--extroversion of 1, where the feedback provides ways to be helpful without triggering the shyness or helpful hints to overcome shyness (or helpfulness, depending on the objective--I frequently tell my husband to stop being helpful--particularly when he thinks he is helping but really isn't). Maybe this is too complicated?¬† But it would work, if you wanted them to get particular feedback for specific results.¬† I don't actually build things with this level of complexity...I just recognize it can be done & how to...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to respond to student feedback?
ResponsesInList.Text: So, if you want something anonymous, then you really shouldn't be able to reply - if it is generic feedback, you might just add a forum and add the students' questions there with your feedback so that everyone can see it as they might have the same question.¬† It adds an extra step of copying the comment/question from the feedback activity but would give the student the idea that their feedback is anonymous...which it really isn't unless you add the feedback on the front page and make it accessible to guests...

ResponsesInList.Title: Behavior changed; non-anonymous now overwrites previous
ResponsesInList.Text: I was using the Feedback activity last year with Moodle 3.2 in a speech class. I set it up so students could submit multiple feedbacks (non-anonymous), and I was using it so that they could evaluate the other students' speeches. This worked flawlessly. I got all the submissions, downloaded them to Excel, and could go through them. I could then give students points for the evaluations. This year I've upgraded to Moodle 3.3 and used the same Feedback activity: multiple submissions and non-anonymous. Now it seems that each submission overwrites the previous submission. Why was this changed? And more importantly: What can I do now that this no longer works? It doesn't appear that there is any other activity that makes this type of activity possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Behavior changed; non-anonymous now overwrites previous
ResponsesInList.Text: Ryan, As far as I can recall, non-anonymous feedbacks have always overwritten the last one entered by the person. I've gotten around this in the past by setting them to be anonymous and then having a field where the person enters their name. You could also try the Workshop activity for peer assessment, or use the Questionnaire plugin which explicitly includes this feature.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Behavior changed; non-anonymous now overwrites previous

However, I definitely did use this one year ago on Moodle 3.2. I've compared the two assignments from the two courses, and they are exactly the same in every aspect except for the students registered. The old one has ALL the responses but this new one only has the latest, so something definitely changed. Cheers!

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback dependancies
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm trying to put a feedback activity together but am having a problem around the dependencies where the item is dependent on having any answer in the short answer question before it, ie: if the question beforehand is answered I want them to go to question 2, but if there is no text I want them to go to question 3. Is this possible and if so how? Many thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback dependancies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sue, Could you give us an example of the text you plan to use for your Short Answer question? The problem I think you are going to run into is that I don't believe the Dependence Item of question 2 can be set to accept "any text" as valid, so you can't use a catch all like the asterisk when used with the Cloze type quiz question. However, you can test for the Dependence item being blank or an empty short answer, so you might be able to trigger you next question based on that. i.e., if the question beforehand is left blank, you can go to question 2, but if there is some text, it will go to question 3. Basically, just the opposite of what you want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback dependancies
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, will give that a try

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide Feedback on Frontpage
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes - add the Feedback to the Main Menu block, take a note of the URL , and then hide the Main Menu block. Give people the link to the feedback activity and it will work as expected. As an alternative to hiding the Main Menu block, some themes allow blocks to be displayed in a special part of the footer, which allows blocks moved into that area to be visible only to admin users. You can add a link to the Feedback in the top menu or elsewhere. Check whether you need to change the setting for "Allow full anonymous" - it needs to be set to "yes" to permit non-logged in users on the front page to complete a feedback activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: This forum post has been removed
ResponsesInList.Text: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide Feedback on Frontpage
ResponsesInList.Text: If you turn editing on, you will be able to add a Main Menu block to the front page. In that block, you can add activities and resources. Those activities and resources will still be available via the URL even if the Main Menu block is hidden. See docs at https://docs.moodle.org/en/Main_menu_block

ResponsesInList.Text: The Feedbacks are separate activities in each course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Report for multiple classes
ResponsesInList.Text: You would have to use something like Configurable Reports for this. ¬†Something that queries the database directly.

However, I am under the gun and need to get the Feedback information so, crazy as it seems I may be reduced to doing that just to satisfy superiors at this point. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Report for multiple classes
ResponsesInList.Text: There is a plugin called configurable reports that makes it a little easier but you still need to be familiar with the database. ¬†Without the time to gain that knowledge, sadly, you will need to export individually from each course. Next time, if you are using the same survey in multiple courses, create it on the front page and then send it to the courses (there is a feedback option for that). ¬†That way, I think you will get all the answers in one place.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, You can do what you want using both the Feedback and Questionnaire activities. There are a couple of things you need to do. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback activity - guest role
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Ross. Is this with a guest user or any user? (Looking at the title of this thread, it's about guest users)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback activity - guest role
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary I working with Guest feedback and that's where it became apparent, but it fails with authenticated users in the same way. I came across what may be a second issue with guest access to feedbacks. problem 1 A guest fills in the first page of a feedback and proceeds to a second page. It appears Moodle saves the first page entries to the feedback table linked to the guest account. The guest either cancels the feedback, navigates to another page or closes moodle without saving the feedback. When another guest accesses moodle the previous guests entries are visible to them. Even after closing moodle¬† and clearing history and cookies. The information seems to be getting stored with the guest account rather than an anonymous feedback. It would seem moodle is treating the guest user as a standard authenticated user by allowing them to continue where they last left the feedback. Problem 2 An extension of the original issue unable to navigate forward or backward through page breaks if there are required fields. When the second guest is presented with the entries of a previous guest who has aborted their multi page feedback where required fields are present on all or some pages. Being unable to navigate forward or back through pages to clear the other guests entries forces them to abort the feedback, possibly rendering all future feedbacks of this instance unlikely unless some bright spark works out what's going on. I have tried this on several feedbacks and the fault is reproducible. Many Thanks¬† Ross

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: conditional questions and guest access

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: sending the feedback to course teacher
ResponsesInList.Text: This is how I handle teacher evaluations: ¬†Create a feedback on the front page of the site. ¬†Set it to be anonymous. ¬†Add permissions to authenticated user and guest to complete the feedback. ¬†I make the first question a dropdown list asking the name of the teacher they are evaluating. ¬†Once it has closed, download to excel. ¬†Here you can filter by teacher and then I just send them their results. ¬†Works really well and students like that it is anonymous.

ResponsesInList.Title: Other User Roll
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello all. I am in need of some assistance with the Other User (s) in courses. At
our company there there are many departments with many managers that
are allowed to create and assign courses. We are a world wide company
and with that there are over 100+ user s with rolls like Department Manager, Site Manager, Course Creator, and so on. In
my department I have created a Feedback form using the Feedback module.
When one of the employees of my department fills out the Feedback form
(used for evaluation and progress in their job), it emails me, the
instructor of that department. However it also emails ALL of the 100+ Other User s that do not need or want this sent to them. Question: How can I limit these Other User s from a course and be able to control who gets the email notification? Any help is greatly appreciated and welcome. Thanks for your time, Dennis

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Other User Roll
ResponsesInList.Text: You could override those roles on that activity so they don't receive emails. In the administration block of the activity you can click on the permissions link to change what the permissions are on that activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Other User Roll
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much of this info. I did not realize that could be done. So if add all roles to Prohibited, then no one would get the emails. Guess that means that I could create a new role, say "feedbackemailuser" and add that role to only the people intended to receive this when the form is submitted? Correct? The help is very much appreciated. Dennis

ResponsesInList.Title: adding Feedback link to front page
ResponsesInList.Text: Maybe it's just me, but I can't find a way to add Feedback on the main front page . I can add the Feedback block. But how do i create a Feedback form from the front page that is not tied to any course, and can be filled by anonymous / guest users ? Thanks for the help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: adding Feedback link to front page
ResponsesInList.Text: Add the Main menu block and add your Feedback from there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: adding Feedback link to front page
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks. I was able to find it before reading this comment. However, i'm still having issues with receiving email notification. I have added an admin account as "teacher" in Feedback Admin > Locally assigned roles. I have also checked that teacher and non-teacher roles (default) have permission to receive email notification. I receive email for other things like for backups and updates, so i assume it's not the mail server . What else can i do to troubleshoot this please? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: adding Feedback link to front page
ResponsesInList.Text: This is sorted. I just had to make sure that all settings are correct. I have been playing with different combinations earlier, my bad. BTW , is it possible to send the content of the "feedback" by email and not just a notification that the form has been completed? The purpose of having it in front page is to have a contact form to which we can respond if needed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Rescale Feedback Responses
ResponsesInList.Text: We have a series of feedback questions that require rating on a 1 to 10 scale. We have recently changed our methodology and have re-scaled the ratings to a scale of 1 to 5. ¬†We understand the math necessary to recalculate the existing responses on the new scale. Is it possible to edit/change the existing responses to new scale range in the feedback survey? ¬†We basically want to change the existing answers. ¬†Thanks in advance for any help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Rescale Feedback Responses
ResponsesInList.Text: No, it is not currently possible. Please create an issue in the Feedback component in tracker with this suggestion, it sounds very useful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback with Pagebreak instead of Comma
ResponsesInList.Text: Please see attaches picture: Is it possible to seperate the three right answers with a pagebreak instead of that Commas?? It should look like Right Right Right

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback with Pagebreak instead of Comma
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, this is a screenshot of Quiz module and not Feedback. Please re-post in quiz module

Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback questions missing after update
ResponsesInList.Text: This actually might just be an issue with my theme...and something breaking in the theme from 2.8 to 3.1...I have a custom theme, so it's plausible that might be the issue.

ResponsesInList.Title: Separating feedback components for analysis
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm curious if there is an option when analyzing your feedback to separate sections of feedback within one feedback activity into different components of analysis. For example, I'd like to export and analyze questions 1 through 5 before the page break separately from questions 6 through 10. Is this possible without creating two separate feedback activities? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback Module missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello I am using Moodle 3.0 and do not seem to have the Feedback Activity Module listed. ¬†I was going to use the Feedback Module to create a contact form. ¬†Now I am not sure what to do next.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Module missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Its disabled by default - Go to Site Admin > Plugins > Activities > Manage Activities and enable it there

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Module missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Richard you are always so helpful. ¬†Thank you. I hope to do the same as I learn more.

ResponsesInList.Title: Automated reminders?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, is it possible for Moodle somehow to send non-respondents an automated reminder a certain number of days or hours before a feedback activity's end time? The message would say something like, "Dear [firstname], please submit your responses to [feedback activity name] before [feedback activity end date and time]." Does anyone know how this can be done?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automated reminders?
ResponsesInList.Text: Closest I can think of is using completion tracking and conditional access to show a label at the appropriate time with that text to people who haven't yet completed the activity. I don't think there is a way to send an email though, unless there is some way to control group access based on activity completion and then set a timed forum post to go out to people in the group of noncompleters.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automated reminders?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Albert, The plugin Event Reminder may do what you want. This plugin is only released for Moodle 2.9 or lower, not for Moodle 3. With kind regards, Hartmut

ResponsesInList.Title: Data analysis in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. I was wondering what type of data analysis is available in Moodle after participants have completed a survey. I know responses can be exported to Excel, but are there any further options, for example, around keyword searches or sorting that are available? Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Data analysis in feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Just the basic stats are available in feedback under the analysis tab. ¬†No sorting etc. ¬†But of course, you have all that functionality in Excel.

ResponsesInList.Title: Placeholders, anonymous/ not anonymous and e-mail to specific user
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! I have created a feedback form to evaluate the course. (Moodle 3.0) But I have couple of problems for it to be good by 100% . 1. We allow to complete the form anonymously (to have more correct answers). But we need to know that the form has been completed by the student. Just the fact that the form has been completed. I cannot find this info anywhere. There is no info in Logs - Activities as well. 2. I want to give the ability for student to show his name. I wanted to use placeholders in question. Like Option 1) Anonymously, Option 2) as¬†{$a->firstname}¬†{$a->lastname}. Unfortunately placeholders does not work here. 3. I need to send info, that student has completed the feedback form to the one particular e-mail address. Just the info that student John has done this. Now there is an option to send the info to the teachers. But I need it to be sent to another person. I wander what teachers will get if the form is submitted anonymously. Thank you in advance for your ideas and help solving this

ResponsesInList.Title: Linking Detailed Feedback Responses overtime and to grades
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I would like to use the feedback module in moodle to have students complete a short motivation survey a few times throughout the semester.¬† I am interested in how shifts in motivation influence their grades in the class and at what time I should offer more resources or study support.¬† I am wondering if there is a unique identifier in the detailed response sheet, such that I could merge the responses over time, also, if I could merge information from the gradebook, such as midterm or exam grade.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Linking Detailed Feedback Responses overtime and to grades
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm looking for a solution to a similar problem. Anybody have any thoughts on this? I'm looking to collect 3 or 4 different Feedback activities every day in a course, and would like to connect and compare each Feedback submission over the duration of the course. Almost like a Journal to look back at previous entries.

ResponsesInList.Title: Changing Question and Submissions setting defaults
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am trying to change the defaults of the Question and Submissions settings in the Feedback Settings. More specifically, I'd like to modify the "Record User Names" and "Allow Multiple Submissions" defaults, since I have many courses' feedback¬†to set up this way. Can anyone tell me¬†how? I have looked it up and looked everywhere in the Administrator settings, and I didn't see it. Thanks in advance Cheers Joe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing Question and Submissions setting defaults
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmm... The Docs for the Feedback Module state: "The feedback module has additional settings which may be changed by an administrator in Administratio.n > Site administration > Plugins > Activity modules > Feedback " However, the only option I see when there is whether or not to allow anonymous surveys on the front page . Unless there is a reason to have no ability to set defaults, maybe you can create Moodle Tracker asking to give admins the option to set defaults for this module. * In the meantime, consider downloading the Sharing Cart plug in. Then you can create a 'template' that you'd like to base all of your Feedback modules on and save this template to your sharing cart. Then whenever you need to add a new Feedback module, just turn on the Sharing Cart block, and download the Feedback template into that course. Nice an simple! *

ResponsesInList.Title: Anonymous Feedback possible without guest login?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, we have Moodle: 2.8.5 and want to implement an anonymous feedback with moodle. Done so far: created a feedback activity on the frontpage set it to anonymous feedback. The problem: Only people that login as guest can answer the feedback, but the guest users can see all courses and course sections We want to prevent that guest users see the courses and course section Questions: Is the full anonymous feedback on the frontpage possible without to login as guest? If not, it is possible to hide all contens in moodle from guests?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anonymous Feedback possible without guest login?
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, there are a couple of other steps. Go into permissions for the feedback and make sure that guest and authenticated user are both selected to complete the feedback. ¬†They should not have to login as guest. ¬†They should just be able to click on it and complete. Also, check your front page settings to see what the default role is for people on the front page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback IN Grade Report but NOT IN assignment activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, Just so that we are clear from the start , this is not a query about feedback not being passed from Activity to the gradebook , its the other way round. One of our academics have graded students in the gradebook for the various assignments that they have been part of . The procedure he has followed is that of giving them a final grade first followed by a feedback for the same in the student's grade report. Although the final grade appears in the assignment grading page under the Final Grade column , the feedback doesn't Assignment Grading page: User report: So here's my question : Just like feedback is passed FROM activity grading page TO Gradebook , does it also work the other way round ? Many thanks in advance Hittesh Ahuja

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback IN Grade Report but NOT IN assignment activity
ResponsesInList.Text: My understanding is that neither a grade nor feedback set in the gradebook directly will appear in the original activity, so It does not work in reverse. Putting a grade or feedback in the gradebook will override what is in the activity module . But as you pointed out, the override will appear in the user report

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback IN Grade Report but NOT IN assignment activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John, Many thanks for your reply. I think this could be a useful feature that I could ask Moodle HQ to add onto . I'll be posting a tracker on Moodle for the same. Thanks, Hittesh Ahuja

ResponsesInList.Title: Deleting wrong feedbackfiles
ResponsesInList.Text: How can I delete erroneous feedbackfiles from a users feedback. See picture. Thanks in advance

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting wrong feedbackfiles
ResponsesInList.Text: You can't delete a feedback fie from the quick grading screen. You need to do it from the individual student's grading page. Click on Edit - Update Grade: Then scroll down to the feedback file area. Click on it and choose the delete option.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting wrong feedbackfiles
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much. Have a nice Christmas vacation. Blessings

ResponsesInList.Title: Dependence value range?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I've searched the forum but haven't found an answer to this. Is it possible to define a (rated) m.c. question range in the dependence value fields? What I would like to achieve is to display a dependent question if a 6 or lower value has been selected on a scale 1-10 in the previous question. I've tried the following values in the dependence value field (none of which worked): 1,2,3,4,5,6 1-6 <6 I have managed to get it to work with single values, which means adding 5 extra questions to the survey which isn't very efficient and bloats the survey especially if you have many of these scaled questions. Regards,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dependence value range?
ResponsesInList.Text: I've also been wondering about this, but it seems it's not (yet?) possible to include ranges in the dependency settings. Just saw someone already opened a tracker issue for this, maybe it helps if you (and everyone else who's missing this) vote for it. Regards, Seb

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dependence value range?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sebastian, Voted! Thanks for bringing it to my attention. Regards, John

ResponsesInList.Title: Dependency Q - Avoid being taken to blank page..
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, first post on this site. I am being driven ABSOLUTELY MAD by this as I'm sure I am missing something obvious but I can't solve this myself! Basically, I am trying to set up our first Feedback module to replace our paper based system. Part of this involves asking if our students have undertaken workshops in 7 different subjects. If they HAVE, then we have 2 questions to ask about that subject. If they HAVEN'T, then we ask about the next subject. So it would look like: Q1. This year, have you undertaken workshops in the subject: PE? Options Yes or No PAGE BREAK If Choose YES: Q1A-Rate My confidence to teach the subject (How you feel about teaching a lesson ) Q1B-Rate My personal subject knowledge (How much do you feel you know and understand) PAGE BREAK Q2. This year, have you undertaken workshops in the subject: Geography? AND IT IS HERE THAT I WOULD WANT THEM TO ARRIVE if they choose No to the original question. However, I can't make it dependent on Q1 answering No as they need to answer this Q no matter what the response. So the 2 pathways that can be taken should be Q1 - YES - Q1A - Q1B - Q2 or Q1 - NO - Q2 The problem I have is when I set this up, if you choose No, it takes me to a blank page every time, as if it is skipping the unwanted Qs 1A & 1B, arriving on the page break as a blank page which must be "clicked" past, then continuing as I wish. This becomes monotonous and unwanted when you have 7+ blank pages to navigate. A workaround is adding a response for if they choose No such as "Please confirm you have chosen No by selecting Next page" but really I don't need this confirmation. PLEASEEE can anyone one help me with how I get from Q1 - Q2 if No is chosen, without arriving at a blank page each time. I would be forever grateful!

ResponsesInList.Title: Svar: Dependency Q - Avoid being taken to blank page..
ResponsesInList.Text: see related post https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=223128 . Check that your dependency-question are NOT "required" - That might be the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Svar: Dependency Q - Avoid being taken to blank page..
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Simon, Thanks for your attempt to help, much appreciated. However, none of my dependency questions are required. Screenshot is shown below: If you choose Yes to the mandatory PE question, everything is fine. If you choose No though, you are still send to a blank page every time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Svar: Re: Svar: Dependency Q - Avoid being taken to blank page..
ResponsesInList.Text: Take away the second page break (after Q1b) Take away dependency on Q 2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Svar: Re: Svar: Dependency Q - Avoid being taken to blank page..
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Simon, Thanks again, but I have already tried this approach. It poses another problem, that the title to the next question (which is about a different subject and so needs to be on a different page) appears directly below the information given about the previous subject. So quiz creation now looks like: But this results in the output: I would say this is worse than having to pass over a blank page as I think it creates the potential for students to mix up what subject they are giving responses about. What I want to create is the 2 options: Q1 (answer Yes) - NEW PAGE - Q1a - Q1b - NEW PAGE - Q2 or Q1 (answer No) - NEW PAGE - Q2 I'm now pretty sure it is a limitation of the software that this isn't possible. If you have 2 different response required - great. If you don't mind your next question appearing below dependent answers when answer is Yes - great. Click past a blank page - great. But you just cannot get the above 2 pathways to exist as outlined above. I may appear fussy, but it is important that the flow of our feedback mechanisms is not disturbed by these issues.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again John - unfortunately I think you are right. Maybe someone else has a solution. (p.s why not skip the label - and try to insert a short introduction before the question? shure - you still have different items on the same page for those who choose YES - but you avoid the empty page for those who choose NO)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Svar: Re: Svar: Dependency Q - Avoid being taken to blank page..
ResponsesInList.Text: There's a tracker item you can vote for to draw a little more attention to this issue: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-51930 ..and while you're at it, you can also vote for this one to get the equally missing option for dependency ranges or multiple values. As in: Q: Do you like cheese on a scale from 1(no) to 6(yes)? A: 6,5 --> Q: Looks like you love cheese, which kind of cheese is your favorite? Q: Do you like cheese on a scale from 1(no) to 10(yes? A: 4,3,2,1 --> Q: You're not a big cheese fan, let's talk about brownies. https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-50662

ResponsesInList.Title: Progress bar in Feedback activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm designing a course with a very long feedback section (~20 Individual questions). In order to avoid discouraging learners, I'd like to incorporate a progress bar similar to the one that appears in lessons I know there isn't an option for this in settings, so I've tried some html and bootstrap elements that I nabbed off various other forums. They appear fine in the rich text editor preview but then disappear in the actual activity. Does anyone know of an alternative way of doing this? This is on 2.9. Thanks, Gareth

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Progress bar in Feedback activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Start each page of the feedback with a text section (information?). ¬†Put a static graphic of your appropriately completed bar at the top. It's a bit of a hack, but it'll work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Progress bar in Feedback activity

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Moodle as an Employee Development tool
ResponsesInList.Text: I've searched and not found exactly what I'm looking for. ¬†Has anyone here utilized Moodle as a tool for employee development? My team develops instructors. ¬†They devote an amount of time observing veteran instructors and are then placed into a classroom to facilitate small sections of the training we provide. ¬†Each time they "co-instruct" they add sections of a four day training program. ¬†During these times, they have a master facilitator with them that takes notes for coaching after the training and the veteran also serves as a "safety net" of sorts in the event the content gets away from the new instructor/facilitator. Development of a new instructor may take up to two years due to scheduling, etc. ¬†The master instructor always spends time prepping with the new instructor and providing daily coaching. ¬†At the end of the 4 day session, the master instructor performs a full debrief with feedback for improvement and positive feedback. ¬†All of this information is then passed on to a master coach that keeps track of an individual instructor's development and hands it off to the next master instructor who will work with the developing instructor. ¬†This continues until that developing instructor is deemed competent to handle their own classroom. I'm looking for a system that will allow for a continuing compilation of both written feedback and likert scale feedback. ¬†One that a master instructor can use to focus on continuing development and that the developing instructor can use for personal development. Is this possible with moodle? ¬†Is there a module that exists that will do this? Thank you in advance for any input you may have. Odie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Moodle as an Employee Development tool
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe you could achieve what you are trying to do with a journal or blog , in terms of the development of ongoing feedback, while scales can be created in either the quiz or feedback. This also seems an ideal situation for users compiling a portfolio or reflective practice journal of some description - that may be best served by integrating mahara with your moodle and using the strengths of both to create what you are looking for.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Moodle as an Employee Development tool
ResponsesInList.Text: I use Moodle for employee development for a 5000+ employee agency, so yes, you can.¬† How you do it is up to you.¬† We do both classroom training (tracked with Facetoface plugin) and on-line training and a few hybrid (some classroom, some on-line). You can include activities, like quizzes, chats, forums, lessons, wikis and written assignments.¬† Forums can include all the instructors, build a sense of community.¬† If several staff are being trained at the same time, a peer feedback activity can be really helpful (workshop)...but this doesn't mean the instructor doesn't also give feedback.¬† You can also create manual grade items in the grade book for off-line activities.¬† The options are pretty extensive...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Moodle as an Employee Development tool
ResponsesInList.Text: My first Moodle was used specifically for this purpose, not as sophisticated as your need, but it has had a lot of trained people go through the courses now available. It took a couple of years to get it where it was really needed as far as developing the materials required, but I suspect it is still developing as to exactly what is needed, as needs change. The real beauty of using Moodle is in that a not-for-profit that must comply with ever changing government regulation, changes can be made quickly and efficiently. The number of courses that use the Journal and blogs are increasing all the time, the Feedback module is being used increasingly, so I noticed when I last looked. (I'm a 'volunteer' admin, i.e. I talked them into using Moodle originally, so was landed with looking after it. Now they have other people running it, so I pop in every now and again to have a look and ask how its all going.) ¬†It still fulfills its secondary function as an information kiosk for their clientele, as well. More importantly, they still smile at me when I go in... and I am not getting panicky phone calls about it not working, so it must be doing the job.

ResponsesInList.Title: add question with dependency
ResponsesInList.Text: hi i'm still new in moodle. Now i'm making a feedback in my moodle. But my boss really need to make it dependent each other, for example: Q1. Do you smoke ? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: add question with dependency
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, here the text from the help button: It is possible to show an item depending on the value of another item. Here is an example. First, create an item on which another item will depend on. Next, add a pagebreak. Then add the items dependant on the value of the item created before. Choose the item from the list labelled "Dependence item" and write the required value in the textbox labelled "Dependence value". The item structure should look like this. Item Q: Do you have a car? A: yes/no Pagebreak Item Q: What colour is your car? (this item depends on item 1 with value = yes) Item Q: Why don't you have a car? (this item depends on item 1 with value = no) ... other items I hope it helps. Best regards Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: add question with dependency
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Andreas, it's really help.. Best Regards, Reza

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback Report (Filter/Sort by Date)
ResponsesInList.Text: We are using Feedback when we want to get the opinions of students about the course. The Feedback Analysis shows the summary of all the responses, our concern is if we can see the summary of responses on specific date only?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback Report (Filter/Sort by Date)
ResponsesInList.Text: The Feedback module has a label where you can add an "information-Type" "Response Time" question. When you download the csv, the data is organized by question on the first tab, and organized by user on the second tab (called "Detailed"). Open it ¬†in Excel, go to the second tab and you can then filter by the date column.

ResponsesInList.Title: Anonymous quizzes and/or surveys
ResponsesInList.Text:
Good morning everyone! In our Institute, we have the Moodle
version 2.2.11, and have a doubt related with quizzes and/or surveys. I want to create a quiz or survey, so the
students can evaluate the course and the teacher, it will be the last topic of
the course, in order to receive feedback and improve it in the following
periods. The problem is: I want to keep the answers of this quiz anonymous but
keep control of which student already fill it out. It is Possible? Thanks you!!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anonymous quizzes and/or surveys
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes -- a combination of the Feedback activity (set to anonymous responses) and Activity Completion (turned on in Course Settings). In the Feedback settings, set your activity completion to trigger when student has completed the feedback response. To see who did/did not complete it yet, simply go to the Course Admin Block, Reports, and then the Activity Completion Report. You'll see all your users and check boxes:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anonymous quizzes and/or surveys
ResponsesInList.Text: Another option, if a grade is still desired, is to manually remove permissions from anyone but the student to see the result.¬† I have a couple quizzes that score and each score means something...I've made the results only viewable for students (and admins...can't block us...but we don't care to look much) and that works pretty well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can't insert images into MC quiz
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, RL. The advantage to using feedback for a pretest type of assessment would mostly be dependent on needing a complex Likert scale set of questions that you want to analyze for patterns and export to a spreadsheet. Since this "export to spreadsheet" feature is key for most feedback use-cases, and using imagery would get in the way of the simplicity of the current feature set in getting a clean download of the data, you probably won't see a feature request to have image uploads to Feedback added in the future. Emma is correct that you probably do actually want the quiz module. You just need to know where the switch is to turn off the feedback for right/wrong answers, if I'm understanding your previous post correctly. See the review options in the quiz settings page for where to turn off what students will see when they answer questions. One other place to tamp down what displays on the left regarding attempt information is in the actual quiz question itself. If you look at a single question in preview mode (click the spy glass icon next to the question on the edit screen, see pic here ) you will also see display options below that will allow you to turn off the points display altogether. The quiz module is actually a pretty powerful tool for doing pretests, so I think you will like it once you get it set up the way you need it set up. Hope those two key areas to check will help you be able to set up a pretest with images. Regards, Lesli

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback won't allow HTML changes in activity name
ResponsesInList.Text: Mod assign has (as an example because its the same in the other mod folders I checked) $mform->addElement('text', 'name', get_string('assignmentname', 'assign'), array('size'=>'64')); if (!empty($CFG->formatstringstriptags)) { $mform->setType('name', PARAM_TEXT); } else { $mform->setType('name', PARAM_CLEANHTML); } Mod feedback simply has $mform->addElement('text', 'name', get_string('name', 'feedback'), array('size'=>'64')); $mform->setType('name', PARAM_TEXT); These are in the mod_form.php file of the modules Bear in mind that if you alter this in core code, it will be overwritten whenever you update. ResponsesInList.Title: Dependency of Feedback on Course

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dependency of Feedback on Course
ResponsesInList.Text: If I understand you - Student completes all activities in a course, making the course 'complete' except for the feedback - which would not be visible until all those activities are completed. BUT you don't want the system to actually show the course as complete until the feedback is done. I would say you can't base the feedback release on course completion then, you need to use the conditional release tool for the feedback activity, where the conditional release is based on a whole series of other activities already being completed. You can then base the course completion on the feedback activity being done as well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A multiple choice with optional text
ResponsesInList.Text: Sia, Are you wanting to include this as part of a quiz? If so, I would just use an essay question that tells them to specify whether they have taken the course before and if so, when. If you want this to be in a quiz, you could also use a two part Cloze question. The first part would be multiple choice with yes and no as the choices. The second part would be a short answer. AL

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A multiple choice with optional text
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry, Al, this is not the correct solution for Sia. What is needed is to use the Dependencies feature of the Feedback activity. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A multiple choice with optional text
ResponsesInList.Text: @Sia, You do not "combine" a MCQ question with a text question. You have to use the Dependencies feature. Here is what the online help says: Dependencies It is possible to show an item depending on the value of another item. Here is an example. First, create an item on which another item will depend on. Next, add a pagebreak. Then add the items dependant on the value of the item created before. Choose the item from the list labelled "Dependence item" and write the required value in the textbox labelled "Dependence value". The item structure should look like this. Item Q: Do you have a car? A: yes/no Pagebreak Item Q: What colour is your car? (this item depends on item 1 with value = yes) Applied to your case, it would look like this: If student answers Yes to the first question on page 1, they are taken to page 2 where they answer the question about "When and where?". If student answers No to the first question on page 1, they are taken to page 3, i.e. they do not see the question on page 2. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A multiple choice with optional text

In fact I created the same exact sample Feeback example except I used the word taken instead of attendance for the dependency. I was getting ready to post it, however, Sia keeps wanting to try for multiple choice with text input at the same time, which can be done in a cloze type question, with the down side of having to do it in a quiz. AL

ResponsesInList.Title: Including Submission Results in Email
ResponsesInList.Text:
As most people know, the feedback module is one of the few modules that guests can access.¬† As a result, it can be used for many purposes, such as a quick survey, contact form, etc.¬† One feature that is a bit difficult is the fact that the results are randomized and the email notifications do not include the submission values.¬† This makes it difficult for using it as a contact form.¬† For example, if a guest fills out the form and submits it, the admin gets an email saying the form was completed.¬† The link in the email sends the admin to the list of submissions, but since the submissions are randomized, it makes it nearly impossible to determine which one was just sent. Before Moodle 2, the Questionnaire module was handy for this because it sent all the form data in the email.¬† However, this cannot be used anymore with guests.¬† Joseph's suggestion is to use LimeSurvey, but I find it to be a bit cumbersome and also I don't want many to many systems for my sites. As a result, I created a patch for the Feedback module that will send the results of the feedback in the email.¬† Only two files were edited: lib.php (patch attached) complete_guest.php (only one line edited - shown below) Edit for complete_guest.php: Line 256, Moodle 2.7.1, replace 
```text
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† feedback_send_email_anonym($cm, $feedback, $course, $userid);¬† //Original
```
 With 
```text
¬†¬†¬† ¬†¬†¬† ¬†¬†¬† ¬†¬†¬† feedback_send_email_anonym($cm, $feedback, $course, $new_completed_id);¬† //Edit
```
 It works well for us, however, I would appreciate any feedback as well as some help with fine tuning it. With the patch, every feedback submitted sends email to the "teacher" of the courses.¬† I would like to add one additional setting in the initial settings of the feedback so the person setting it up can decide whether to have the submissions sent to the teacher in an email or keep the original functionality. Maybe something like Include submission values in email (default no) Once this is in, I can make the appropriate changes in the two files to honor the setting. Any "feedback" would be appreciated (no pun intended... well, maybe some pun was intended) Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Including Submission Results in Email
ResponsesInList.Text: I was hoping someone would chime in about this, but no one did.¬† I am giving this discussion a little "bump" in hopes someone can throw their two cents in.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Including Submission Results in Email

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Including Submission Results in Email

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Customizing Completion Tracking

We have added a piece where we track if a user's supervisor has reviewed the feedback. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback with Teaching Staff
ResponsesInList.Text: I found the solution in a previous post from Andreas Grabs. https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=213257 To allow teacher & non editing teachers to complete feedback ....you have to override the permission in the feedback-instance its self. 1) Go into your course 2) Click on your feedback you want to use for your teachers 3) Click on "Permissions" inside the block "Settings" 4) In the dropdown list "Advanced role override" choose "Teacher" or how ever your teacher role is named 5) Look for "mod/feedback:complete" and set it to "Allow" 6) Click on "Save changes"
