ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback - email notification
ResponsesInList.Text: I GOT IT! I GOT IT! I solved both problems at once by upgrading from 1.9.2 to 1.9.3 AND upgrading the questionnaire to 1.9. This fixed the width issue with the theme/layout and gave me guest access to questionnaire thus generating an email to admin without actually having guest write an email. Lesson learned: stay on top of those upgrades!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback - email notification
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, be sure the following things has been set. all users who should get an email are assigned to an role on the frontpage. If you don't want the users have any rights to edit some things on frontpage you can assign the users to the role "guest". Now you can assign these users to the role teacher or editingteacher locally on the feedback. You also can create an own role for example "feedbackemailuser". On this role you set the capability "Receive email notification" to "Allow". After this you can assign all users which should receive an email to this role on the frontpage or locally on the feedback. Now the wanted users should receive an email. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: We are looking for a way to do a "Professor Course Evaluation" using Feedback. We would like the professor to answer a series of questions about the class and students, that is, the professor answers the questions (which are not seen by the students). Can this be done in "Feedback" or is there some other way to do this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, you can hide feedbacks for different users with grouping (available since moodle 1.8.x). You could put the teachers into a special teacher-group and this group in a grouping. Then you can set the grouping options in the edit-area of the feedback. If the teachers have the editingteacher role so you have to override the role for this feedback. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas, Thanks for the reply. I did as you suggested but obviously have missed something. I created a group for the professor and overrode the"Feedback" to allow the professor to have full privileges. I still do not see where the professor can complete the Feedback. Other suggestions? Stan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stan,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas, We are working with 1.8.3 which does not have the grouping feature. I will see if we can upload the most recent version. Aside from upgrading, do you have any other suggestions for capturing feedback from a professor about his/her own class that is not seen by students? Thanks, Stan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stan, you can hide the feedback. So only teachers can see this. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas, Even though I am using version 1.8.3 do you still think I can have a feedback that the professor can complete? I have created groups in my version, but I have been unable to find a way for the teacher of the course to take the feedback. Thanks, Stan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Teacher Response
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stan, you have to switch the role-settings for the special instance of your feedback in your course. Go to the feedback and click "Update this Feedback". Click "Override permissions" (on the tab-row above) Click on the editingteacher role Select "Allow" on the first row "Complete a feedback" Select "Prevent" on the row "Edit items" Now only teachers can see this feedback, because it is hidden and they can fill out this feedback because the permissions are changed. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stan, did you test it as admin or as teacher? The settings will only work for teachers. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Cant see a form?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jonathan, Do you mean that you can't see the form as if you were viewing it from a student's perspective (including entering data)? If yes, this would be the expected behavior for the Feedback module (at least under 1.7, I haven't checked this in 1.8/1.9): When you look at /admin/roles/manage.php?roleid=3&action=view on your Moodle site, you will see that, by default, the permission for the capability "mod/feedback:complete" is set to "prevent." Once you change this to "allow," you should be able to fill in the form as a teacher. Hope this helps Cheers, Markus

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Cant see a form?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, I have been having a similar problem. I wrote to Andreas Grabs, developer of the module and explained my predicament. He pointed out that it was a roles permission problem. The lecturers, though, students in the course with the feedback module, were course creators at the system level, hence they would be course creators in every child course - meaning course on the system. I would therefore advise you to check whether or not the teachers are course creators/teachers in a context that would include the immediate context of your course with the feedback module, for eg. are the teachers course creators at the level of the course category or at the system level? If they must be course creators at the level of the course category you may need to move the course with the feedback module to another course category. If the teachers are course creators at the system level you should reconsider the wisdom of this as it gives them course creator access to every course on the moodle system. The roles paradigm though exciting in the possibilities does take time to work through.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Setting Roles on Front Page Feedbacks
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andreas, With the latest version, students can now access the feedbacks from mapped courses when the feedbacks are hidden on the front page. Thank you - this gets us a lot further along! Our next issue is that we want to let department admins manage their feedbacks and get results. Here's what I did: 1. Created a new role - Course Evaluation Admin. This is a duplicate of the Authenticated User role, with all of the feedback permissions set to 'allow', as well as moodle/course:viewhiddenactivities. 2. Assigned a user to this role on a feedback activity. When the user logs in and goes to the front page, she does see the grayed-out link in the Main Menu block for the feedback, and can click the link to view the feedback. However, when clicking on any of the tabs (Edit Questions, Templates, etc.), or the Map to Courses button, she gets 'Sorry, this activity is currently hidden'. Is there an additional capability that needs to be set, or maybe a better way to accomplish allowing certain users to manage hidden front-page feedbacks? Thanks! -Ann

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Setting Roles on Front Page Feedbacks
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ann, I'm not sure whether I can help you for this. It seems to be a general issue. All activities have this behaviour. If you hide an activity this setting is saved on the course-context level and not on the module-context level. If you assign roles on the feedback-context it has no effect on this setting. You can try the following procedure: 1) create a new role with legacy role type "None". 2) set all capabilities to "Not set" 3) set the capability "viewhiddenactivities" to "Allow" 4) assign your feedback-manager to this role on Frontpage-roles 5) go to the hidden feedback and assign this user to the teacher-role on this feedback The effect is that the user now can see all hidden activities on the frontpage but he/she can not go into these activities except the assigned feedback. Best regards Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Setting Roles on Front Page Feedbacks
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas, Thank you very much - I appreciate all your help. It does work to give the users a role with the viewhiddenactivities capability on the front page, and a role with manage feedback permissions in the feedback context. With this process, and the fix for student access of hidden front page feedbacks, I think we now have a workable solution for our course evaluations. -Ann

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: can I recover from this disaster?
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess I used the wrong tool for the task but it occurred to me that I could use Feedback to collect data about our students submissions of their final projects but this has become a little nightmare. The idea was simple and I don't know why it shouldn't work. I created a little survey where the students had to introduce (as the answer to different questions) their first name, their last name, the name of their project and the name of the project supervisor. I thought this would save us a lot of time since we would not have to write the title of each student's project in a spreadsheet. The first problem I encountered is the organization of the data. This is my fault because I didn't check how Feedback would output the results into a spreadsheet. I thought that I could export the data into a spreadsheet in the following format: Last Name First Name Project's name Project supervisor Smith Axel How to build a... Peter Brown Seifert Nina Analysis of... Principles of Dana Peterson Peter Brown But Feedback exports the data like this: Last Name Smith Seifert Garc√≠a First Name Axel Nina Mar√≠a .... ---------- Well, that's not the real problem. I thought I would simply cut the columns for the different sections and paste them next to each other to achieve the desired format (as in the table above). I was horrified, however, when I saw that the columns are not ordered! So for instance, I would get: Last Name Garc√≠a Seifert Smith First Name Axel Mar√≠a Nina Project's name Analysis Principles of How to build a.. Project supervisor Peter Brown Peter Brown Dana Peterson So when I paste the different columns next to each other I get things totally mixed up: the Last Name from one person, the First Name from another, the title of the project from a different person, etc. What on earth is going on? I can understand that Feedback will organize the results as a single column instead of rows and columns. But why doesn't each column follow the same order? (where each position in the column for each category or question corresponds to the answer given by the same person) This doesn't make sense. The order of the column for each category seems to be totally random. I have more than 100 entries! Does this mean that I will have to access each answer through 'show responses' and add all the data by hand in a spreadsheet? Please tell me that this is not so. Is there anyway out of this mess?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: can I recover from this disaster?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Josep, have a look at the excel-export. There is a second worksheet called "detailed". There you will find the data as you described. Each row stands for one submit. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: can I recover from this disaster?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback results lost???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alfredo, the feedback-tables are called feedback_xxx. The prfx can you find on your config.php and the xxx named the tables content. The values of your feedbacks are stored on the table feedback_value. Each value has a reference to an feedback_completed entry. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback 1.9 fails to remove slashes when editing questions
ResponsesInList.Text: When you edit a question in Feedback under Moodle 1.9, the backslashes used to escape quotes and apostrophes in the database are not being stripped out by the module. As a result, the slashes show up when you're editing the question, and are saved to the database when you save the question. To recreate the problem: 1. Create a Feedback. 2. Add a question with a quote or apostrophe in it. 3. Save the question. 4. Edit the question. The backslash should appear. 5. Save the question. The backslash is saved to the database. I added a report and proposed patch to tracker for this problem: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-15331

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: adding identification to feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Thomas, you can try two things. first: switch the configuration for the excel encoding to latin. You can do that on "Site Administration" -> "Language" -> "Language settings". There you will find this option at the bottom of this page. If this still isn't working so you can try the second one: Open the file "easy_excel.php" from feedback-folder with an simple text-editor (not Word or OpenOffice!) Go at the bottom of this file. You will find the function "feedback_convert_to_win()". It should look like this: function feedback_convert_to_win($text) { global $CFG; static $textlib; static $newwincharset; static $oldcharset; if(!isset($textlib)) { $textlib = textlib_get_instance(); } ... Put directly below the line "function feedback_convert_to_win($text) {" the statement: "return $text;" It now should look like this: function feedback_convert_to_win($text) { return $text; global $CFG; static $textlib; static $newwincharset; static $oldcharset; if(!isset($textlib)) { $textlib = textlib_get_instance(); } ... I'm hoping it helps. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: adding identification to feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas Your suggestion did help. Switching the Excel encoding language to Latin (using Moodle "Site Administration", "Language", "Settings", "Excel encoding") did the trick. I very much appreciate all the time you've devoted to this... thanks! Thomas Coppens

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installation 'Error'
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alex, it is important to use the right feedback-module for the related moodle-version. You should clean up your system and new install the feedback-module. Go into the "Site Administration" -> "Modules" -> "Activities" -> "Manage activities" and delete the feedback-module (note: all existing feedbacks on installed courses will be deleted) After that you should look at the database whether there still are some feedback-tables. If it is so you can drop all tables which start with mdl_feedback.... At the end do a new install with the correct feedback version. Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: multilang problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Daniel - Which version of Moodle and feedback are you using? I know that there were some changes to the way that multilang works in Moodle 1.8. I'm assuming you are working off of:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: multilang problem
ResponsesInList.Text: In Moodle 1.9 under administration there is an option in filter settings to filter all strings. If you turn this on you will find that it translates the titles and headings for you. Let me know if that works for you. For more details see: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Multi_language_content#Course_summary_and_title_tags Peace - Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: multilang problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Anthony, I am running final Moodle 1.9 and feedback version 2007102603. The "filter all strings" setting is activated in my installation. It translates many things, but not everything. As I could see, html-block titles and also this feedback-issue were not filtered by this setting. But I think its nearly the same problem I had with html-block and multilang (see: http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=93491 ), so the fix should be the nearly the same? Regards, Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: multilang problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I found a solution that works fine for me: Edit file /mod/feedback/view.php at line 90: original version: print_heading($feedback->name); changed into: print_heading(format_text($feedback->name)); regards, Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: multilang problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel, thank you for find out this. I have put this in all files with the print_heading(...) lines. Have a good weekend! Andreas

This is a serious problem because the survey was conducted by one of our graduate students for her Masters thesis and she needs to identify which users answered each question in a particular way. Can anybody help, please? Josep M.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: Josep - Did you say that you were upgrading feedback from Moodle 1.7 to Moodle 1.8? I would be interested in seeing the Moodle. xml file that is created. In particular I would want to make sure that all of the fields are included in the backup and which version of the feedback module you were using to do that backup. Peace - Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anthony, Thanks a lot for your prompt response.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: OK - that is how I would have done it as well. I'm confused about whether the feedback is listed as anonymous or just the feedback_completed (i.e. the responses). You're expressing yourself clearly and well (pero si prefiere en espa√±ol o una mezcla via correo-e est√° bien, como quiera). Paz - Antonio

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I see you speak Spanish Since this exchange might be useful for other people, we might continue in English. Where I see the feedback is listed as anonymous is when I click on the link for the survey from the course's main page and then I click on the 'show responses' tab. Then it says "non-anonymous entries (0)" / "anonymous entries (154)" Do you see what I mean? In principle, if the feedback survey was set up for non-anonymous responses, why would all the responses be listed as anonymous? Josep M.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Josep, I just have seen this issue too. The problem is the default value of the new field anonymous_responses in the table feedback_completed. You can fix this by call the following sql statement: UPDATE `mdl_feedback_completed` SET anonymous_response = 2 WHERE userid >0 I have to change this in the cvs . Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas - Great to see your response. Thanks for clarifying, I had forgotten which values of anonymous_response mean what (i.e. anonymous or not anonymous). I would be careful about simply changing the table default. I would think that a better solution would be to make the default value of the anonymous_response field depend on whether the feedback itself is listed as being anonymous or not. If the feedback activity is not anonymous, then assume that all of the responses were not anonymous (during an upgrade). If the feedback activity is anonymous, then the default anonymous_response should be anonymous. Does that make sense? What I would want to avoid is upgrading what was previously an anonymous feedback and having the results appear non-anonymously. I would rather see the case that Josep is experiencing where he has to work and cleaning up the data to make then visible again. Peace - Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I see what Anthony says and it might indeed be undesirable that an anonymous feedback turns into a non-anonymous feedback during an upgrade. But you guys should work out a solution that doesn't imply having to "hack" the database after upgrades. Many users might not know how to do the cleaning up and a task that might be simple for you can be daunting for many people who are not used to go "under the hood". Independently of how this is solved, thanks very much for your prompt responses. I'll try to follow Andreas advice to see whether the problem is solved. Happy new year! Josep M.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Answers appear as anonymous in Feedback but they weren't

When I set up a feedback on the main page, then create a block in the relevant course to see the feedback, I get the following: 1) The link to the questions does not display below the intro text when I click on the feedback in the block (in the course) if the feedback is set up to store the user name and info 2) The link to the questions does display if I set the Feedback up to allow anonymous user entries. I allow multiple entries. How can I overcome this? Thanks Mariana

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback not giving link to questions when non-anonymous
ResponsesInList.Text: I have now upgraded to Moodle 1.8.3 in the hope that this will solve the problem, but it is the same. The problem is: 1) Logged in users do not get the "Answer the questions" link if they click on a feedback in the feedback block that is set to capture the name of the user. They do get that link if they are not logged in. This means that I can only use the feedback module with the "Anonymous" setting for logged in users - it makes no sense to me. Does anybody else experience this problem? Regards Mariana

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback not giving link to questions when non-anonymous
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mariana! I was having the same problem and apparently found a solution. In order to get identified answers you will need to set roles on the first page, which, for Moodle, is also a course. I set everybody as student¬†and it worked. The new problem is that new members will only be able to answer after you define their role.

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Feedback for Instructor Evaluation - How can I copy to other sites
ResponsesInList.Text: This looks just great for instructor and course evaluations. Can I create one feedback and copy it to other courses?¬† I would like to make it standard throughout the college.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Instructor Evaluation - How can I copy to other sites
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes it is possible. What version of moodle and feedback do you use. With version 1.7 and above you can save questions a a template and make it public. When you then make a new feedback in every course of your system and choose this template you have all question in it and you have only save your feedback. Another way is to make a backup only with feedback. When you give this zip-File to instructors then can insert it with restore in their couses. Hope this help. Andr√©

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Feedback for Instructor Evaluation - How can I copy to other sites
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you! Cool!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Display - brackets, brackets everywhere!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Display - brackets, brackets everywhere!
ResponsesInList.Text: Ian not sure if this is the proper way to do it but I downloaded and unzipped the feedback module onto my pc and found the folder moodle\lang\en_utf8\ which contains a folder called help and two files block_feedback.php and feedback.php. I then ftp 'd into my moodle server, I opened the moodle\lang folder on the server and copied the files block_feedback.php and feedback.php into the en_utf8 folder on the server and copied the folder feedback into the help folder within en_utf8 on the server. I am not sure if that's what I was supposed to do but it seems to have worked, that is stopped the bracketing! Dave

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Strange Display - brackets, brackets everywhere!

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: New Feedback Question Format
ResponsesInList.Text: WANTED: New Feedback Question Format There is one wish-list that I would like to see in the next version of Feedback module. A feedback question that have unique answers for each question. Let me explain further.... suppose a feedback has 3 questions - Q1, Q2 and Q3. So, there will be at least 3 answers - A1, A2 and A3 (and so on) If the student select A1 as the answer for Q1, then the student should NOT be allowed to select A1 for Q2 or Q3. Same goes for A2 and A3. (Each answer can only be displayed ONCE in a question AND there should be more answers than question or else there will be questions without answers). Do hope to see such features in the Feedback module and Andreas' comments about this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: New Feedback Question Format
ResponsesInList.Text: This seems to be possible in the Questionnaire module http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=71966

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: New Feedback Question Format
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Timothy, Bug Catcher is certainly aware of this possibility in the Questionnaire module, since he specifically asked for this question type last May and I took the time to answer his wish and to make this possibility available in the Questionnaire module (see the discussion linked in your post). Also, our friend Bug Catcher has repeatedly been asking for this feature to be made avaialble in the Feedback module in his posts dated Thursday, 24 May 2007, 12:15 PM, Thursday, 21 June 2007, 03:50 AM, Tuesday, 10 July 2007, 03:26. I do hope moodle users realize that most of the moodle modules & plugins are created and maintained by people who are doing this as voluntary work, on top of their normal job , are sometimes "amateur programers" (like myself), do their best to answer users' wish-lists, cannot be expected to create new features at the snapping of one's fingers and are only expecting the (occasional) users' expression of gratitude as way of payment for their efforts. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: New Feedback Question Format
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph That must be frustrating. Tim

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stephen, as I see do you use moodle 1.6.x. The excel-export for that version has some limitations. UTF-8 characters will not be converted. The max length of text is 255. Can you more precisely describe your issue? Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exporting to Excel error in Feedback module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stephen, currently there is no way to extend the amount of text. I planned an update of this version but I'm not sure when I will have time to do this. You can backup your course and restore it on a moodle 1.7.x or later.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: New Feedback format.
ResponsesInList.Text: I was wondering if the feedback can add a new function whereby a feedback that only accept one single choice for all the questions in the feedback. Let me explain further below. For example, there are is a feedback that have 5 questions (Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4 and Q5) and 5 choice (A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5). So, all the 5 choices will be available to the student for all the 5 questions. However, if the student select A3 for Q1, then, he will not be able to select A3 for Q2, Q3, Q4 and Q5. (One unique choice for each question.) The reason for this new function is that currently there are other format such as the Multiple-Choice feedback (with either one OR multiple choice) but there isn't any feedback that have function like the one that I say above. If anyone know of such plug-in that works like the above. Please kindly let me know. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: New Feedback format.
ResponsesInList.Text: I have also wondered about the possibility of a question type which would force a single select both in columns and rows in a set of horizontal and vertical radio buttons. As far as I know this is not possible, or not easily. We need this when e.g. asking respondents to classify items in order of preference, which is currently not possible with existing question types. For example if we asked this question: rate these 3 VLEs in order of preference, we would like it to be impossible to check radio button #2 for two VLEs. Any ideas anyone? Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: New Feedback format.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire: New Question format.
ResponsesInList.Text: I am pleased to announce that I have solved this problem. The solution relies on some Javascript which, upon one of the radio buttons being clicked, verifies the checked value of the other buttons in the same column and, if any of those buttons had previously been checked, unchecks it. I have implemented the solution in my proposed version 2 of the Questionnaire module, and it can be tested live on my test site . See login instructions etc. in this post . The questionnaire which features one question with this new system is in Topic 1, CMS Survey, Question 1: Psychologists have determined that certain colours etc . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: add_to_log patch
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas, With the patches I sent you, we began giving course evaluations. One problem that came up was teachers could not view which students submitted even though the data was in the mdl_log table. This was because the cmid (course module id) was not being added. To correct this I changed line 118 of the /mod/feedback/complete.php file from: add_to_log($course->id, "feedback", "submit", "view.php?id=$cm->id", "$feedback->name"); to: add_to_log($course->id, "feedback", "submit", "view.php?id=$cm->id", "$feedback->name",$cm->id,$userid); This explicitly passes the course module and userid. I was able to use SQL to fill in the cmid since it was being stored in the URL with an UPDATE mdl_log

ResponsesInList.Title: feedback for 1.7 is ready
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm happy to say the feedback-module is ready for moodle 1.7. Before you use it in a production-system it should be well tested. There may be some small bugs and/or missing lang-strings. Here the main changes: the installation now uses the install. xml roles are full implemented view complete deletecompleteds mapcourse edititems viewreports createprivatetemplate createpublictemplate deletetemplate now radiobuttons and checkboxes can be aligned horizontally or vertically radiobuttons now have an option "not selected", so the user can deselect a previous done selection. there is a new item-type "numeric" what can save unsigned numeric values. You can define a range (from - to) the user has to keep. now you can insert pagebreakes a feedback what is switch to the next page is saved temporary. the user can cancel the completion and later continue at the last filled page. (Except the guest-users of course) now you can ex-/import feedbacks into/from a xml-file course-reseting is supported You can download it here: feedback_17.zip Important: this version of feedback-module only runs on moodle 1.7.x or later. It definitly does not run on moodle 1.6.x or earlier. Of course you can import courses from versions before without any problems. Thanks at all for the many good suggestions. Best regards Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Svar: feedback for 1.7 is ready
ResponsesInList.Text: We're trying out Feedback in Moodle 1.8, and have encountered a peculiar thing that we do not fully understand. It seems like a student who is a member of the course can take the survey and have the answers saved to the database. It seems like a teacher who is a member of the course can take the survey and have the answers saved to the database. Those two feel straightforward enough. It seems like an administrator can not take the survey at all. This looks consistent with the answer in http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=27556#p250790 , and is logical. It seems like an administrator who has switched to the student role and is a member of the course can take the survey, but the answers are silently dropped instead of inserted into the database. This looks somewhat consistent with the above mentioned answer, but caused a bit of confusion for us and our customer. The last case, with an administrator posing as a student and having the answers thrown away, is it by design or by mistake? If it is by design, would it be possible to include a text somewhere around the submit button telling the administrator/student that the answers will be discarded? Moodle: 1.8 Feedback: 2007013002 OS: CentOS 4.4 Apache , postgres .

ResponsesInList.Title: Feedback: Dropdownrated Display
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas, In the feedback for Moodle 1.6 (feedback15.zip), I had some users complaining that the results were not showing for a dropdownrated item when it was a required field. The problem was that some of the ratings had no description. I realized that there was an inconsistency in the way the data was being displayed between analysed_print and print. I made the display more consistent ( IMO ) by making the following changes to /mod/feedback/item/dropdownrated/lib.php @@ -147,3 +147,3 @@ $quotient = number_format(($val->quotient * 100), 2, $sep_dec, $sep_thous); - echo '-  ('.$val->value.' ) ' . trim($val->answertext).'' . $val->answercount. (($val->quotient > 0)?' ('. $quotient . ' %)':'') . ''; + echo '-  ' . trim($val->answertext) . ' ('.$val->value.'):' . $val->answercount. (($val->quotient > 0)?' ('. $quotient . ' %)':'') . ''; } @@ -204,3 +204,2 @@ print_simple_box_start('left'); - echo '('.text_to_html($dropdown_value[0], true, false, false).') '; echo text_to_html($dropdown_value[1], true, false, false);

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Dropdownrated Display
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anthony, I'm not sure what version of feedback do you mean. The relevant places already are: ... trim($val->answertext) . ' ('.$val->value.'): ... and ... echo text_to_html($radio_value[1], true, false, false); ... Or did I overlook something? Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feedback: Dropdownrated Display
ResponsesInList.Text: Andreas - In the /mod/feedback/item/dropdownrated/lib.php file feedback_print_analysed_dropdownrated function, I am suggesting to put the value first and then the answertext so that it displays (value): answertext which in my opinion formats better when displayed (see attached). Otherwise, the value gets concatenated at the end and is not aligned. I like the value aligned on the left as it seems cleaner to me. So instead of ... trim($val->answertext) . ' ('.$val->value.'): ..., I am suggesting ... ' ... ('.$val->value.')':. trim($val->answertext) ... I realize it is a minor change but I think it helps. Regardless of the order you choose, I think that feedback_print_analysed_dropdownrated (in the /mod/feedback/item/dropdownrated/lib.php - it appeared that you may have been looking at the /mod/feedback/item/radiorated/lib.php) and feedback_print_dropdownrated functions should display in a similar fashion. Hence to get the (value): answertext type format I suggested above I added the line: echo '('.text_to_html($dropdown_value[0], true, false, false).') '; before the line: echo text_to_html($dropdown_value[1], true, false, false); Ist dieser Reiniger? I hope that helps to clarify why I made the changes I did. Peace - Anthony
